trans-unit.source: Represents an individual data item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The ListViewDataItem class represents an individual data item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
A data item usually corresponds to a record in a data source object.
The class derives from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> class.
Each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control has a designated item type that is represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property.
When the item type is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType?displayProperty=fullName>, you can use the ListViewDataItem class to get more information about the item.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control stores data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Items%2A> collection.

To determine the index of a ListViewDataItem object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Items%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DisplayIndex%2A> property.
To determine the index of the data item in the underlying data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItemIndex%2A> property.

The difference between these index properties is that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DisplayIndex%2A> represents the position of the data item in the current page, whereas <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItemIndex%2A> is based on the page offset.

If the paging functionality is not enabled in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control by using a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control, these two properties will contain the same value.
You can access the properties of the underlying data object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem%2A> property is available only during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the ListViewDataItem class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem"></xref> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem> class.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItemIndex%2A>|The value of the `dataItemIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DisplayIndex%2A>|The value of the `displayIndex` parameter.|
The index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem*> in the underlying data source object.
The position of the data item as displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the underlying data object that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> object is bound to.
The DataItem property is available only during and after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemDataBound> event of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
The underlying data object that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem"></xref> object is bound to.
Gets the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem*> in the underlying data source object.
Use the DataItemIndex property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem%2A> in the underlying data source object.
The zero-based index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem.DataItem*> in the underlying data source object.
Gets the position of the data item as displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The DisplayIndex property corresponds to the current position of the item as displayed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
Each item's DisplayIndex value reflects the order in which they were added to the control in that particular page of data.
You can use the DisplayIndex property to retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewDataItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Items%2A> collection.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data items.
It does not apply to insert items or empty items.
The zero-based position of the data item as displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
The event data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event has been sent to the parent control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
